intro: Peperomia ternata var. abrupteacutata, commonly known as the Sharp-leaf Peperomia, is a compact evergreen shrub native to tropical regions of South America. It features small, ovate leaves with a pointed tip and a glossy, dark green surface. The plant produces tiny, pale green flowers that are clustered in spikes, typical of the Piperaceae family. It thrives in bright, indirect light and well-draining soil, making it a popular choice for indoor gardening. Its slow growth rate and attractive foliage make it an ideal plant for container cultivation.
